# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function you are looking for:
```julia
function clean_column(col) 
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), ' ', '_'), '-', '_')
end
```
In this function, `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespaces from the column name. `lowercase(strip(col))` converts all characters in the string to lower case (making it case-insensitive). Then `replace(lowercase(strip(col)), ' ', '_')` replaces all spaces with underscores, and `replace(..., '-', '_')` replaces any hyphens with underscores. Finally, we return this modified column name.
